Chief Executive Jensen Huang later told industry contacts that the investment was not binding and had not been finalized, the report said. He also raised concerns about OpenAI's business approach and competition from companies such as Alphabet's Google (NASDAQ:GOOGL) and Anthropic.

results.title: Nvidia Stock Investors Got Great News From Palantir and Teradyne - The Motley Fool
results.content:
## Nvidia reports its quarterly earnings on Feb. 25

Nvidia is scheduled to report its fourth-quarter and full-year fiscal 2026 (ended in late January) results on Wednesday, Feb. 25, after the market close. (It generally releases its results at 4:20 p.m. ET, in my observation.) An earnings call with analysts is scheduled for 5 p.m. ET the same day.

For Q4, management guided for revenue of $65 billion, representing year-over-year growth of 65%. It also guided (albeit indirectly, through several inputs) for adjusted EPS of $1.50, representing 69% growth.

# Nvidia Stock Investors Got Great News From Palantir and Teradyne

ByBeth McKenna – Feb 3, 2026 at 9:09PM EST

## NASDAQ: NVDA

### Nvidia

Market Cap

Today's Change

(-2.82%) $5.23

Current Price

$180.38 [...] Avg Vol

3.2M

Gross Margin

57.96%

Dividend Yield

In Q4, Teradyne's revenue jumped 44% year over year to $1.08 billion, driven by strong demand for its testing equipment for AI-related chips, both compute (the category that includes the GPUs that Nvidia designs) and memory (Nvidia buys memory chips for integration with its GPUs for its AI data center chips). Adjusted EPS soared 89% year over year to $1.80, crushing the $1.38 Wall Street had expected.

CEO Greg Smith said, "In 2026, we expect year-over-year growth across all of our businesses, with strong momentum in compute driven by AI."

Teradyne stock rocketed 13.4% on Tuesday.

## Nvidia reports its quarterly earnings on Feb. 25

results.title: Nvidia Stock Dips On OpenAI Funding Issues - Investor's Business Daily
results.content:
BREAKING: Palantir Jumps Late, Leads Big Earnings Movers

 Technology

# Nvidia Stock Dips On OpenAI Funding Issues

Nvidia (NVDA) stock dipped Monday on conflicting news reports that the artificial intelligence chipmaker lacked confidence in major customer OpenAI and might have doubts about how much to fund it.

The Wall Street Journal reported Friday that Nvidia's plan to invest up to $100 billion in OpenAI to help it train and run AI models had stalled. Nvidia insiders expressed doubts about the deal, announced last September, the article said.

↑
X

This video file cannot be played.(Error Code: 102630)

See All Videos [...] See All Videos

The AI Inference Pivot: Why 2026 Could Be The Most Complex Chip Cycle In Decades

The report said Nvidia Chief Executive Jensen Huang had privately criticized what he has described as a lack of discipline in OpenAI's business approach. He also expressed concerns about the competition OpenAI faces from Anthropic and Alphabet's (GOOGL) Google.

On Saturday, Huang told reporters that Nvidia was prepared to invest "a great deal of money" in OpenAI, Reuters reported. "I believe in OpenAI. The work that they do is incredible. They're one of the most consequential companies of our time."

Huang didn't say exactly how much the company would invest in OpenAI but described it as "huge" and potentially "the largest investment we've ever made." [...] 5:06 AM ET

results.title: Up 1,479%, Wall Street Sees Sandisk Hitting $1,000 - 24/7 Wall St.
results.content:
Certain periods create opportunities that expand far beyond the initial spark. Where AI was what lit the fuse that initially sent Nvidia (NASDAQ:NVDA) soaring, we are now seeing the ripple effects from it — spreading to critical enablers like high-density storage for training and especially inference. 

Investors need to broaden their lens to look for investments beyond just the traditional chipmakers, and Sandisk is now one stock that should command the sort of attention once reserved for Nvidia.

results.title: Nvidia stock gets major reality check on ‘$100B’ number - thestreet.com
results.content:
From its 10-Q:

 Nvidia repurchased 70M shares for $12.6 billion in Q3 FY26.
 Nvidia repurchased 262M shares for $36.7 billion in the first nine months of FY26.
 It was authorized to repurchase up to $62.2 billion more, as of Oct. 26, 2025.

So here’s the true stock angle. If Nvidia can continue to buy back shares on a large scale while simultaneously supporting the ecosystem, it strengthens the “AI cash engine” story on which the multiple is based.

## What would actually move NVDA stock from here

NVDA stock requires tangible catalysts rather than just positive sentiment. This includes three main drivers. [...] Regardless of your personal opinion, the standard mega-cap argument is no longer valid, with the tech giant now firmly in the perpetual AI capex machine space. This means any issues with OpenAI will lead to a sharp hit in the sentiment.

CEO Jensen Huang swooped in, though, saving the day with some sharp statements in Taipei.

“No, no, nothing like that,” he said, when asked if the investment would be more than $100 billion.

What does that mean for traders? It means, very simply, Nvidia is saying it will help pay for one of the world’s top consumers of AI computing, even if it is already guiding to $65 billion quarters.

## The Nvidia stock angle investors should anchor to

NVDA is now trading at a price that requires clear confirmation that “AI demand stays hot.” [...] The market valuation of NVDA was around $4.64T at the end of the day on Jan. 31.
 Trailing P/E is at 53.81, and forward P/E is about 29.94 (Yahoo Finance key metrics).

At that multiple, the market wants growth and ecosystem financing to stop “pulling forward” growth; that is the current concern about Big Tech expenditures.

## The 3 numbers that explain why Huang is doing PR on a weekend

### $57.0B: revenue base (and it’s still accelerating)

Nvidia’s fiscal Q3 2026 (ended Oct. 26, 2025) was a blockbuster quarter.
